name: anoint
content:
anoint verb [T]
(IN A CEREMONY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make someone holy in a religious ceremony by putting holy water or oil on them
to make someone king or queen, especially as part of a religious ceremony: [ + obj + noun ] In 751 Pepin was anointed king.

anoint verb [T]
(FOR A JOB)
formal to choose someone to do a particular job, usually by a person in authority: [ + as + noun ] It remains to be seen whom the chairman will anoint as his successor.

to put water or oil on someone in a religious ceremony: The archbishop was anointed in a ceremony at the cathedral.
Anoint also means to choose someone or something for a particular job or purpose; designate: He anointed his eldest son as his successor. They anointed broadband as the Next Great Thing.
